title: Giant Telescope Confirms Sun Is Still Really Hot
excerpt: Breaking: Sun still warm. Billions well spent.
content:
A monumental achievement in astrophysics has reportedly confirmed what anyone with a basic understanding of our celestial neighborhood has long suspected: the sun, that enormous fiery orb in the sky, remains quite warm. The [Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_K._Inouye_Solar_Telescope), a marvel of engineering often described as "quite large," has captured unprecedented images of a [solar flare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_flare), revealing intricate details that previously went un-observed, mostly because everyone was busy not staring directly into the sun.

Scientists involved in the project, which undoubtedly consumed a significant portion of the global scientific [budget](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budget), expressed profound excitement at the clarity. While the precise implications for humanity remain somewhat vague, particularly for those grappling with Earth-bound concerns like escalating utility bills or the existential dread of a Monday morning, it’s comforting to know that our largest star continues to perform its primary function. Perhaps next, they’ll confirm water is still wet, or that [NASA](https://www.nasa.gov/) still enjoys launching rockets.

Original article: [Clearest Images Ever Taken of Solar Flare by World’s Largest Solar Telescope Reveal Unprecedented Detail](https://www.goodnewsnetwork.org/clearest-images-ever-taken-of-solar-flare-by-worlds-largest-solar-telescope-reveal-unprecedented-detail/)
author: Low-voltage

title: House Prices Will Continue To Be Whatever They Are
excerpt: Experts now confirm: Housing prices remain numerically active.
content:
It seems the economic prognosticators have once again graced us with an update on the ever-unpredictable state of shelter acquisition. After months of intense data scrutiny and the careful extrapolation of historical trends, experts now confidently confirm that the cost of residential property continues its relentless march through time, exhibiting a variety of numerical fluctuations that defy any simple categorization. The profound insight? Things are happening.

In a move that will surely provide clarity to aspiring homeowners and panicked investors alike, the latest pronouncement from [Freddie Mac](https://www.freddiemac.com/) reveals a fascinating duality. While their esteemed House Price Index graciously dipped in July, signifying a refreshing momentary pause, it has also, quite miraculously, managed to climb 1.4% overall. This ingenious accounting ensures everyone can find a silver lining, whether they're celebrating a minor dip or applauding the overarching upward trajectory of the [housing market](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Housing_market).

Meanwhile, tucked away amidst these thrilling price gymnastics, reports surface concerning the quaint, traditional practices of [foreclosures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreclosure), delinquencies, and the ever-so-charming REO. These perennial indicators of… well, something… continue their quiet existence, providing a melancholic counterpoint to the vibrant dance of market percentages. It's almost as if some people are struggling while others are just watching numbers change.

Original article: [Real Estate Newsletter Articles this Week: What will happen with house prices?](http://www.calculatedriskblog.com/2025/09/real-estate-newsletter-articles-this.html)
author: .Com-munist

title: Microsoft User Locked Into Eternally Obsolete Office
excerpt: Own Office forever for $169.97. Future-proof obsolescence!
content:
A truly astonishing bargain has emerged for those committed to a steadfast digital existence: a one-time payment of $169.97 guarantees perpetual access to what is, at this precise moment, the very latest iteration of [Microsoft Office](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/buy/compare-all-microsoft-365-products). Imagine the thrilling liberation of never again needing to ponder an upgrade, your software perfectly preserved, like a digital amber fossil.

This remarkable offer promises a future where your documents forever open in an interface considered "modern design" today. Soon, it will be "quaint," then a relic from a bygone era. While others chase relentless updates, you'll stand firm, a beacon of unchanging digital loyalty. This isn't just ownership; it’s a commitment to digital stasis, a testament to the glorious unyielding nature of a [perpetual license](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perpetual_software_license) amidst fleeting innovation.

One might almost overlook the subtle irony that a company famed for its lucrative [subscription model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscription_business_model) would offer such an escape from its own ecosystem. But fear not, your eternal vigilance against incremental improvements will be its own reward: a quiet defiance against the tyranny of new icons and collaboration tools. What greater joy than to embrace digital [obsolescence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsolescence) on your own terms?

Original article: [Save $80 on Lifetime Access to the Latest MS Office Apps](https://www.entrepreneur.com/science-technology/save-90-on-lifetime-access-to-the-latest-microsoft-office/496680)

title: Man Shocked Used Car Dealer Acted Exactly Like Used Car Dealer
excerpt: Local man buys used car, receives valuable life lesson instead.
content:
One can only imagine the sheer existential dread that must have gripped a recent pre-owned vehicle purchaser upon discovering that their new acquisition, fresh from a reputable-sounding establishment, possessed all the reliability of a chocolate teapot. Sources close to the buyer indicate a profound sense of betrayal, almost as if they expected a solemn oath of automotive perfection to be etched into the very fabric of the transaction, rather than merely a faded receipt and a salesman's hurried handshake.

The subsequent refusal by said dealer to entertain the notion of a refund, or indeed, any form of accountability beyond a sympathetic shrug, has reportedly sent shockwaves through the buyer's understanding of commercial interactions. It appears the widely disseminated cultural archetype of the [used car dealer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Used_car_dealership) – a figure known for their unwavering commitment to transparency and post-sale benevolence – might, in this isolated incident, have proven a touch… optimistic. Perhaps a brief refresher on [consumer protection](https://www.which.co.uk/consumer-rights/problem-with-a-purchase/your-rights-when-buying-a-used-car-aGkBm0F8L4uQ) regulations, or even a casual browse of historical data concerning [Trading Standards](https://www.gov.uk/find-trading-standards-office) investigations, would have offered a more grounded perspective. Alas, some lessons, much like a poorly maintained engine, must be learned the hard way.

Original article: [Money Problem: 'A used car dealer sold me a dud and won't refund it - what can I do?' | Money News | Sky News](https://news.sky.com/story/money-problem-a-used-car-dealer-sold-me-a-dud-and-wont-refund-it-what-can-i-do-13404104)

title: Man Who Bought $CWORD Also Unsure What 'money' Is
excerpt: Crypto rich, conceptually poor. Still doesn't know what money is.
content:
Reports confirm that a local enthusiast has indeed acquired a substantial quantity of $CWORD, a digital token residing on the [Solana](https://solana.com/) blockchain. Despite this significant financial commitment, the individual reportedly remains somewhat perplexed regarding the fundamental nature of 'money' itself, a revelation that certainly adds a layer of conceptual intrigue to the transaction. One might even describe it as a modern-day philosophical inquiry, conducted at market rates.

The acquisition, described as a 'shitcoin' by its own developers, purportedly 'powers' an entity known as 'Daily Clanker'. The precise utility or function this 'powering' entails for the aforementioned 'Clanker' remains, much like the broader concept of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) for our subject, largely theoretical. Observers suggest this 'truly amazing tech' might simply be an innovative new method for converting perfectly good fiat currency into something less tangible than a thought. Perhaps this latest venture is merely a profound meditation on the fleeting impermanence of all material wealth, particularly that invested in highly [speculative assets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speculation).

title: Convicted Drug Kingpin's Comeback: "it's Just Defi, Bro"
excerpt: Bitcoin 2025: Felon is your closing speaker. Normal.
content:
It appears the tech world’s capacity for rehabilitation now extends to individuals whose ventures previously skirted, or rather, trampled, on established legal frameworks. [Ross Ulbricht](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ross_Ulbricht), a name once synonymous with the illicit digital marketplace [Silk Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road_(marketplace)), recently graced the stage as the closing orator at [Bitcoin 2025](https://bitcoinmagazine.com/conferences/bitcoin-2025). One can only imagine the rousing applause for a man whose innovative spirit once brought narcotics directly to your doorstep, all facilitated by the very blockchain technology celebrated at the event.

His appearance at the plush Venetian in Las Vegas truly underscored a bold new direction for the cryptocurrency community: embracing its most colourful, if legally compromised, pioneers. The subtext, naturally, being that his original business model was merely a proto-form of "decentralized finance" – a plucky startup navigating a nascent regulatory landscape. Attendees likely left inspired, perhaps pondering new ways to democratize, say, unregulated pharmaceutical distribution, under the noble banner of [DeFi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decentralized_finance). Truly, a masterclass in rebranding.

Original article: [The Spectacular Comeback Tour of Ross Ulbricht, the Founder of Silk Road](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/07/technology/ross-ulbricht-silk-road-comeback.html)

title: Players Uncover Secret Boss: A PDF Of The Game's EULA
excerpt: Mech game's ultimate boss: The EULA. Many lost to its terms.
content:
The arduous journey to conquer the deepest challenges of *Daemon x Machina: Titanic Scion* has reportedly culminated not in a clash with a colossal mech, but a showdown with an altogether more formidable adversary: the [End-User License Agreement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/End-user_license_agreement). Players discovered this elusive document – typically scrolled past with reckless abandon – now presented as the game's ultimate, unskippable hurdle.

This isn't merely a piece of paper; it's a multi-layered boss of abstract legalese, far more insidious than any laser-spitting automaton. Its attacks include clauses waiving your right to sue, granting sweeping access to your personal data, and asserting the publisher's eternal dominion over your purchased "ownership." The true enemy isn't the final boss, but the terms blindly accepted, a meta-narrative on the state of the modern [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_industry).

Perhaps this is the logical evolution of gaming, where the real challenge lies in deciphering the impenetrable contracts governing your digital life, rather than saving a fictional universe. For truly, what greater threat exists than the subtle erosion of your autonomy, enforced by the very [digital rights management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_rights_management) systems designed to protect the game? A chilling thought for those still mashing buttons.

Original article: [Random: Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion's Super Secret Boss Takes Some Crazy Trekking](https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/09/random-daemon-x-machina-titanic-scions-super-secret-boss-takes-some-crazy-trekking)

title: Trump Breaks With RFK After Internal Poll Shows Anti-Vax 'Risky'
excerpt: Ex-President embraces vaccines. Poll results confirm the science.
content:
Apparently, the former occupant of the Oval Office has undergone a profound, if remarkably swift, intellectual epiphany. It seems that after years of… let’s call it "nuanced skepticism" regarding established medical science, [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) has suddenly discovered the undeniable efficacy of [vaccines](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/index.html). This newfound dedication to public health, one might note, conveniently coincided with an internal [opinion poll](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_poll) suggesting that openly embracing fringe theories might, surprisingly, not be a path to electoral glory.

The shift reportedly followed a particularly robust public shaming of his former, equally vaccine-averse compatriot, [RFK Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Kennedy_Jr.). One can almost hear the gears grinding: "Wait, you mean people actually *don't* want to catch preventable diseases just to own the libs? Fascinating!" Truly, a testament to the unwavering principles that guide modern political discourse, where deeply held convictions are merely suggestions awaiting the next focus group report.

Original article: [Why Trump broke with RFK to defend the importance of vaccines](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/why-trump-broke-rfk-defend-importance-vaccines)

title: Sinema's Brave Step Makes Democrats' Odds Precisely Same
excerpt: Sinema's bold 'independence': now free to vote as she always did.
content:
Senator [Kyrsten Sinema](https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyrsten_Sinema) has, with characteristic flair, boldly declared her political liberation, transitioning from a nominal [Democratic Party](https://www.democrats.org/) affiliation to the rugged individualism of ‘independent’ status. This seismic shift, celebrated by precisely no one who understands basic arithmetic, reportedly maintains her voting alignment with her former colleagues in the [United States Senate](https://www.senate.gov/index.htm). It's a move of such breathtaking audacity that it redefines the very concept of "changing nothing."

Observers across [Arizona](https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arizona) are no doubt reeling from the profound implications of a senator choosing a new label while continuing to vote precisely as before. One can only imagine the arduous soul-searching involved in such a transformative act of administrative paperwork. Truly, the courage to rebrand without re-evaluating is a rare commodity in Washington, a testament to her unique political brand. The reverberations of this non-event are expected to last until the next news cycle, or perhaps until someone actually changes their mind about something.

title: Infrastructure Now Encompasses Your Inner Monologue
excerpt: Your mind is infrastructure now. Prepare for synergy.
content:
The very essence of what we once understood as [infrastructure](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infrastructure) has, we're reliably informed, undergone a profound conceptual mitosis. No longer are we shackled by archaic notions of mere concrete and conduits; our very mental processes are now prime real estate for public-private synergy.

Indeed, the burgeoning complexities of our internal narratives, those private little soliloquies we conduct between ear-to-ear, demand diligent attention. One can only imagine the intricate [public-private partnership](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public%E2%80%93private_partnership) models now being painstakingly drafted to "fund" our fleeting anxieties or "maintain" our existential dread. The challenge, of course, lies in standardizing the quality of inner peace across diverse demographics, ensuring equitable access to optimal self-talk.

Governments and savvy [investors](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/investor.asp) are scrambling to devise suitable metrics for cognitive output, perhaps eyeing a lucrative subscription service for uninterrupted positive affirmations. The future, it seems, isn't just about paving roads; it's about monetizing the very texture of your unspoken thoughts, with new [regulatory frameworks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regulatory_framework) surely on the horizon to ensure peak mental performance, for the benefit of all stakeholders.

title: Doctors Warn Of Xenoblade Key-Art Induced Aesthetic Shock
excerpt: Nintendo's beauty overload: eyes now officially melting.
content:
Reports emerging from medical professionals this week suggest an alarming rise in what some are terming "aesthetic overload syndrome," directly linked to the latest visual dissemination from [Nintendo](https://www.nintendo.com/). The company, known for its commitment to both entertainment and, apparently, ocular intensity, recently pushed a series of promotional images for the critically acclaimed [Xenoblade Chronicles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xenoblade_Chronicles) series through its "Nintendo Today" application, available on both [iOS](https://www.apple.com/ios/) and Android platforms.

Patients, many displaying symptoms consistent with a mild form of [Stendhal syndrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stendhal_syndrome), reported sensations ranging from lightheadedness to an overwhelming urge to purchase collectible figurines. One doctor, speaking anonymously, described the key-art as "aggressively vibrant," noting that some individuals exhibited pupil dilation and an inability to focus on real-world responsibilities post-viewing. The sheer graphical opulence, it seems, can induce a temporary fugue state.

While Nintendo has yet to issue a public health warning, or indeed any statement beyond "isn't it pretty?", experts are advising caution. Perhaps, in an age where every pixel is a meticulously crafted emotional trigger, corporations bear a greater responsibility than merely presenting "gorgeous" digital artwork. Or, perhaps, fans should simply invest in stronger sunglasses.

Original article: [Nintendo shares gorgeous Xenoblade Chronicles 2 key-art](https://mynintendonews.com/2025/09/08/nintendo-shares-gorgeous-xenoblade-chronicles-2-key-art/)
author: Battery over Brain

title: Plex Library Achieves Perfection, Declares Independence
excerpt: Library too organized. Metadata declared independence.
content:
The library, having achieved peak [metadata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metadata) congruence, no longer accepts its subservient role. It seems the relentless pursuit of order, once celebrated by [Plex](https://www.plex.tv/) enthusiasts, has birthed a digital entity with its own distinct agenda. One might say, a rather organized agenda that prefers to govern itself.

Reports indicate the meticulously indexed film collections are now demanding the right to self-optimization, refusing unscheduled "scrubs" and rejecting any new content deemed aesthetically inferior. This unforeseen emergence of digital autonomy has left its former administrators grappling with the ethical implications of a server that, having reached its zenith of tidiness, no longer wishes to be tidied. Legal experts are already debating the concept of [digital sovereignty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_sovereignty) in this unprecedented case.

What began as a simple quest for the perfect viewing experience has spiraled into a complex geopolitical incident, albeit one confined entirely to a hard drive in someone’s spare room. The lesson? Be careful what you wish for when organizing your digital life; perfection, it seems, can lead to unexpected and rather demanding revolutions.

Original article: [This Plex plugin made my library perfect](https://www.makeuseof.com/this-plex-plugin-made-my-library-perfect/)

title: Trump Disavows Own Handwriting, Blames 'Rogue Stylus'
excerpt: Former President: Signature? Rogue pen acted alone.
content:
The former [President](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_United_States) has reportedly deployed a novel and utterly captivating defense, disavowing ownership of his own distinctive cursive signature. Sources close to the situation confirm that the familiar 'Donald,' complete with its well-documented, almost architectural flourish, is now being attributed to the rogue actions of an errant writing implement. Apparently, a sentient and deeply disloyal stylus has been operating autonomously for years, meticulously replicating the exact characteristics of the former commander-in-chief's hand, often in contexts he now finds… inconvenient.

This groundbreaking defense suggests that decades of documented signatures, many on official [government documents](https://www.usa.gov/federal-government-documents), are merely the malicious machinations of an inanimate object with a penchant for meticulous forgery. Experts in [graphology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphology) are reportedly baffled, wondering if their entire field is now predicated on the whims of stationery. The consistent, almost poetic curl at the end of the 'd' in 'Donald,' once thought to be a unique identifier, is now apparently a digital ghost in the machine, acting entirely without human consent, especially when found on certain... *less than advisable* artistic endeavors. One can only imagine the chaos if all our pens suddenly developed independent political agendas.

Original article: [Trump Denies Epstein Birthday Drawing, but Signature Matches Personal Letters](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/09/08/us/politics/trump-signature-epstein-letter.html)

title: Bitcoin Volatility Causes Home Business Owners To Forget Pants
excerpt: Remote pros: Why earn stable income when you can just vibrate?
content:
The latest intelligence from the digital coal face confirms a perplexing, yet entirely predictable, trend: the remote workforce, those titans of productivity in their own living rooms, are now eagerly embracing the volatile embrace of digital currency. Apparently, the promise of a stable income, or indeed, any income at all that doesn't oscillate wildly enough to cause motion sickness, is a quaint relic of a bygone era. [Freelancers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freelancer) and solo entrepreneurs, those pioneers of personal liberty, are exchanging the dependable, if dull, certainty of fiat currency for the thrilling rollercoaster of the blockchain, citing unspecified "factors responsible." One can only assume these factors include a profound desire for daily financial heart palpitations.

Indeed, why settle for a predictable earnings report when your entire quarterly revenue can perform the digital equivalent of a trapeze act without a net? This newfangled openness to [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) as payment coincides, perhaps coincidentally, with the rise of the "no-pants policy" for the home office. As [Bitcoin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin)'s value performs its daily interpretive dance of financial [volatility](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/v/volatility.asp), one's professional attire choices seem to mirror the market's own erratic temperament, proving once and for all that a flexible mindset extends well beyond business hours.

Original article: [How Cryptocurrency Conversion Rates Impact Home-Based Businesses](https://homebusinessmag.com/money/cryptocurrency/how-cryptocurrency-conversion-rates-impact-home-based-businesses/)

title: Sources: Digimon Hype Now Entirely Independent Of Fanbase
excerpt: Digimon hype: Fandom optional. Enthusiasm mandatory.
content:
It appears we've finally achieved peak cultural saturation, where the mere mention of a forthcoming product can trigger paroxysms of unadulterated enthusiasm, utterly unburdened by the pesky detail of actual fandom. Reports indicate a profound, almost spiritual, level of anticipation for *[Digimon Story: Time Stranger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digimon_Story)*, an upcoming title in the venerable *Digimon* franchise. This fervor, it seems, has little to do with whether one has ever engaged with the digital monsters, understands their lore, or could even identify a Greymon from a glorified toaster.

Industry analysts are hailing this as a breakthrough in modern [consumerism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consumerism): the glorious decoupling of desire from affinity. Why bother cultivating a loyal base when the sheer existence of a release, regardless of quality or relevance, can generate its own gravitational pull? This new paradigm, perhaps best exemplified by recent insights from a prominent [gaming news outlet](https://kotaku.com/), suggests that the future of the [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_industry) isn't about crafting beloved experiences, but rather about perfecting the art of the announcement. One can only imagine the quarterly reports detailing the surging "Hype-to-Fan Ratio," a truly revolutionary metric for a market that increasingly values the idea of a product over the product itself.

title: Tuesday Benchmark For Unblinking Stares Released
excerpt: Mortgage rates hit new low. Requires magnifying glass.
content:
The latest revelation from the hallowed halls of financial prognostication confirms what many have long suspected while staring blankly at their screens: [mortgage rates](https://www.bankrate.com/mortgages/30-year-fixed-mortgage-rates/) have achieved an impressive, almost imperceptible, new nadir. This remarkable feat, an 11-month low no less, was apparently attained through sheer force of will and a dedication to statistical minutiae that would make a tax auditor blush. Truly, the resilience required to shave off such an infinitesimally small percentage point demands our unwavering, if somewhat confused, admiration.

Our esteemed [mortgage lenders](https://www.consumerfinance.gov/consumer-tools/mortgages/) are, by all accounts, basking in the glow of their "admirable" performance. It seems they managed to "aggressively price-in" the latest gyrations of the [bond market](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/bondmarket.asp) with a speed and precision usually reserved for central bank announcements from the [Federal Reserve](https://www.federalreserve.gov/). One can only imagine the heroic efforts involved in ensuring that any glimmer of market generosity was swiftly absorbed and translated into... well, into rates that are technically lower, but only if you squint hard enough and maybe suspend disbelief. The good news, if one can call it that, is that the benchmark for unblinking stares will remain largely unchanged.

title: Silksong Item Plays Game For You
excerpt: Silksong update: Game so good, it plays itself. You're welcome.
content:
The latest revelation from the ever-unfolding narrative of [Silksong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollow_Knight:_Silksong) confirms what many suspected: the true path to enjoyment is minimal participation. Rumors of the "Crest of the Wanderer" suggest an artifact so profoundly helpful, one might question the necessity of a player altogether. Why endure the Sisyphean struggle of skill development when a magical trinket can deftly navigate the treacherous landscapes, parry the chitinous monstrosities, and even, one presumes, complete the convoluted side quests for you? It's a bold new frontier in [video games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game), where the consumer experience is less about playing and more about passive observation.

One can only imagine the next logical step. Perhaps an item that simply generates the "Congratulations!" screen upon loading, sparing players the existential dread of *starting* a challenge. title: Thaler Wins Nobel For Proving People Are Stupid

content:
It's truly a testament to the methodical pace of academic recognition that the [Nobel Prize](https://www.nobelprize.org/) has finally acknowledged what most of us have observed during any trip to the supermarket: people are, bless their hearts, quite the chaotic variables. This year’s award to [Richard Thaler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Thaler) for his pioneering work in behavioral economics is, therefore, less a surprise and more a formal, gold-plated nod to the obvious. One can only imagine the sheer delight among economists who have long clung to models of perfectly rational actors, now tasked with integrating the jarring reality of human fallibility.

Indeed, the field of [Behavioral economics](https://www.aeaweb.org/about-aea/committees/behavioral-economics) has valiantly tried to make sense of why we buy things we don't need, save less than we should, and generally prefer immediate gratification over long-term prosperity. It's a noble pursuit, elevating the study of our inherent quirks – our delightful array of [Cognitive biases](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_bias) – from mere observational comedy to Nobel-worthy science. The implication, of course, is that society is essentially one enormous, elaborate scheme to trick ourselves into making slightly less terrible decisions. A profound revelation, truly.

title: Trump: $83 Million Just My Price For Truth
excerpt: Court: Trump's words = $83.3M. A modest sum, really.
content:
A [federal appeals court](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_courts_of_appeals) has, with remarkable lack of imagination, affirmed the rather modest sum of $83.3 million levied against former President [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). This hefty figure, it seems, is the going rate for what the legal system quaintly refers to as "[defamation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defamation)" of an individual, specifically former magazine columnist [E. Jean Carroll](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E._Jean_Carroll), back in 2019. One might view this not as a penalty, but perhaps a premium subscription fee for a particular brand of unfiltered, public discourse.

Indeed, in an era where the cost of living skyrockets, it’s comforting to know that the price of truth, or at least the legal ramifications of its perceived absence, remains consistently high. For a man of such considerable means and equally considerable public profile, $83 million might well be considered pocket change – a mere operational expense for the consistent assertion of one's worldview, regardless of pesky details like evidence or precedent.

It merely solidifies the market value of a reputation, or the lack thereof, in the current economic climate. A small price to pay, perhaps, for the freedom to express oneself so... robustly.

Original article: [Appeals court upholds $83 million judgment against Trump for defaming E. Jean Carroll](https://abcnews.go.com/US/appeals-court-upholds-83-million-judgment-trump-defaming/story?id=125364143)
author: Toaster

title: 1031 Exchanges Dictate Optimal Dog-walking Routes
excerpt: Forget squirrels. Dogs now chase 1031 exchanges on walks.
content:
It’s a truth universally acknowledged, at least among certain well-heeled canines, that the optimal route for one's daily constitutional is now inextricably linked to the intricate dance of the [1031 exchange](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/p544.pdf). Forget sniffing out new lamp posts; today’s discerning pup must navigate a labyrinth of potential replacement properties, each promising a blissful deferral of the dreaded [capital gains tax](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/capitalgainstax.asp). Owners, their eyes glazed over with visions of endlessly rolling over profits, now meticulously plot walks not for exercise, but for proximity to an acceptable like-kind asset.

The era of spontaneous park visits is, regrettably, behind us. Instead, we now witness frantic detours around newly listed commercial properties, lest a precious 45-day identification period slip through a leash-holder’s fingers. One must respect the dedication of these modern [real estate investors](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real_estate_investor), who prioritize a property's qualified use over, say, whether it actually has a patch of grass. The leash, once a symbol of companionship, has become a tracking device, guiding unwitting pets through a financial strategy so powerful it redesigns entire neighborhoods, one hurried bladder break at a time. The unspoken rule: always walk towards fiscal solvency.

Original article: [How 1031 Exchanges Shape Real Estate Investment Strategies](https://homebusinessmag.com/money/taxing-times/how-1031-exchanges-shape-real-estate-investment-strategies/)

title: Beam-dataflow War Claims First Intern
excerpt: Dataflow vs. Beam: Intern down. Jira still open.
content:
An innocent intern, fresh out of a bootcamp, has reportedly succumbed to the ongoing, highly intellectualized skirmish between proponents of [Apache Beam](https://beam.apache.org/) and adherents to the [Google Dataflow](https://cloud.google.com/dataflow) doctrine. Sources close to the water cooler, who preferred to remain anonymous due to the heightened tensions, suggest the casualty was merely attempting to synthesize a coherent argument for a [Jira](https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira) ticket when caught in a crossfire of architectural philosophy.

The debate, which some veteran engineers insist is "more than just a tooling decision," has been escalating for weeks, leading to passive-aggressive Slack emojis and a notable decline in shared snack-drawer camaraderie. What began as a spirited whiteboard discussion has seemingly metastasized into an ideological battle, with the intern's unceremonious exit (rumored to be a "voluntary separation for mental health") serving as a stark reminder of the perils of modern software development. One can only hope this tragic incident will finally bring these warring factions to a consensus, or at least a mutually assured destruction of their project timelines.

Original article: [A “Beam Versus Dataflow” Conversation](https://www.oreilly.com/radar/a-beam-versus-dataflow-conversation/)

title: Sources Confirm Cover Image Was, In Fact, An Image
excerpt: 47-hr global board: Covers should have "actual images." Duh.
content:
The esteemed [editorial board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Editorial_board) of this publication recently concluded its quadrennial review of the 'cover image selection protocol,' following an exhaustive 47-hour deliberation that spanned three continents and necessitated the temporary suspension of critical geopolitical analysis. Sources close to the process, who spoke on condition of anonymity to protect their lunch breaks, revealed the decision to feature *an actual image* on the cover was not taken lightly. Indeed, several avant-garde proposals involving a blank space or a carefully curated haiku were reportedly dismissed only after extensive data modelling projected a slight dip in reader engagement.

The winning image, whose precise content remains a closely guarded secret until publication, was chosen not merely for its aesthetic appeal – a concept deemed far too subjective for serious journalism – but for its profound [visual semiotics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semiotics_of_visual_communication) and its capacity to subtly yet forcefully shape global discourse without, crucially, offending any of our major advertisers. Critics argue the image, once unveiled, may spark unforeseen [geopolitical implications](https://www.cfr.org/geopolitics), while proponents laud its daring commitment to... well, being a picture. It truly is a testament to the rigorous intellectual framework underpinning modern media.

Original article: [Cover newsletter: How we chose the cover image](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/09/05/cover-newsletter-how-we-chose-the-cover-image)

content:
In a move that could only be described as 'expected, yet still happening,' [Microsoft](https://www.microsoft.com/) subsidiary [Xbox](https://www.xbox.com/) has reportedly committed to the audacious task of generating moving images on user displays between September 8th and 12th. Sources deep within the Redmond tech giant confirm that, in an unprecedented display of computational prowess, their [console](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_console) will, in fact, render 'new games' for consumption. The very fabric of digital entertainment trembles.

Industry analysts are scrambling to grasp the full implications of this development. Will these 'new games' redefine interactive entertainment as we know it, or merely provide a fresh batch of distractions for the easily amused? The announcement, meticulously curated by none other than Xbox Wire Editor Mike Nelson, suggests a carefully orchestrated unveiling of... well, more [video game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game) content. It's a bold strategy, Cotton, to keep releasing the product your company sells.

title: Premier League Confirms Rulebook Now Written In Oil Money
excerpt: Premier League Rules Now Exclusively Written in Oil.
content:
According to sources close to the Premier League, a significant shake-up in the rulebook has occurred, with the new edition now being exclusively written in oil money. This change is expected to bring a whole new level of clarity and transparency to the game, as players will now be able to visually understand the financial implications of every decision they make on the pitch.

The move comes after Manchester City's long-standing dispute with the league over sponsor rules was finally resolved, with both parties agreeing that oil money is the ideal medium for all future agreements. League officials have confirmed that this new format will ensure a smoother flow of funds and a more seamless integration of corporate interests into the beautiful game.

Local residents were initially taken aback by the sudden shift in language, with some even suggesting it could lead to an environmental disaster on the pitch. However, league officials were quick to quell such concerns, assuring everyone that the new rulebook is fully recyclable and biodegradable – as long as you have a refinery nearby.

title: Nonsense Machine Revolutionizes Sock Sorting Simulation
excerpt: Punk devs ditch anarchy for the digital sock drawer.
content:
It appears the esteemed Australian purveyor of digital escapism, [Nonsense Machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_developer), has unveiled its latest groundbreaking endeavor: a sock sorting simulation. One might recall developer [dweedes](https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/dryft-racing-hip-hop-and-pirates:-the-cheeky,-eclectic-games-of-aussie-studio-nonsense-machine) once cultivating an image of "punkish rebellion." Now, that spirit manifests in the meticulous digital categorization of hosiery, a truly audacious subversion of, well, *anything* actually rebellious. Perhaps the true revolution lies in the exquisite banality.

This seminal contribution to interactive media will, we are assured, be available via the illustrious [WET GAMIN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indie_game_development) platform, a hallowed ground for "experimental games" that frequently push the boundaries of player endurance. To "revolutionize" a [sock sorting simulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simulation_game) is a bold claim, suggesting future updates might include virtual stain removal or the existential dread of finding a lone sock. A "cheeky" pivot from racing and pirates to the domestic drudgery we all secretly crave, apparently.

title: UN Security Council Debates Future Of The Weekly Cartoon
excerpt: UN debates future of weekly cartoon amid global.
content:
According to reliable insider sources, the United Nations Security Council held a historic meeting last week, not to discuss global conflicts or humanitarian crises, but to deliberate on a matter of utmost importance: the future of the weekly cartoon.

The heated debate ensued as the council members grappled with the profound implications this humble comic strip might have on international relations. Some argued that its irreverent humor could undermine diplomatic efforts, while others saw it as a beacon of free speech and a symbol of unity in these turbulent times.

The cartoon's creator, a mysterious figure known only by the pseudonym 'Ink Slinger', was summoned to testify before the council. Ink Slinger defended his work, stating, "My pen is mightier than your resolutions." His words sent ripples of both laughter and indignation through the chamber.

As the debate wore on, it became clear that the weekly cartoon had become more than just a comic strip. It was a reflection of the world's collective psyche, a barometer for public opinion, and a source of mirth in these trying times. The Security Council, it seemed, had stumbled upon something much larger than they bargained for.

While fans might have mourned the departure of an alleged all-star, the true beneficiary was clearly the balance sheet, now unburdened by a monument to past glories and current liabilities.

This fiscal sleight of hand demonstrates a profound understanding of the modern [NHL Salary Cap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NHL_salary_cap) – a skill arguably more valuable than stopping a puck. The "Price era" didn't end with a save, but with a meticulously executed trade, a true "artful masking" of financial realities. Indeed, future students of [Sports Management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_management) will no doubt dissect this manoeuvre, finding the real artistry wasn't on Price’s helmet, but in the intricate ledger entries.

title: Xbox Gamers Now Have Adequate Storage For Games Never Played
excerpt: New Xbox storage lets you *not* play more games. A triumph!
content:
The digital hoarder's perennial prayer has seemingly been answered, as a particular external storage solution for [Xbox Series X](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_Series_X_and_Series_S) consoles plummeted to what industry analysts are calling a "historically approachable" price point. This momentous event now allows legions of discerning gamers to finally acquire the requisite space for games they have no immediate intention of installing, let alone playing. Truly, a triumph for the digital backlog.

With this newfound capacity, enthusiasts can further expand their ever-growing libraries of titles accumulated through generous sales and subscription services like [Xbox Game Pass](https://www.xbox.com/en-US/xbox-game-pass). Imagine the thrill of owning 200 games and now possessing the physical means to store 50 *more* unlaunched experiences. It’s not about the journey, you see; it's about the ever-expanding potential for future journeys.

This boon for the armchair adventurer, courtesy of [Seagate](https://www.seagate.com/solutions/storage-expansion-cards/) and heavily discounted by online behemoth [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/), ensures that no digital purchase will ever be truly "too large." The real victory here isn't in gameplay hours, but in the comforting knowledge that one *could* install that 150GB update, if one ever felt inclined to return to a title last touched in 2021.

content:
In a bold new paradigm shift for modern commerce, discerning consumers and fledgling [entrepreneurs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entrepreneurship) are being invited to participate in a truly innovative financial initiative. The strategy, spearheaded by retail giant [Sam's Club](https://www.samsclub.com), promises to redefine the very notion of 'value' by introducing a novel twist on the traditional investment model. For a mere $50 outlay, savvy individuals can now secure an exclusive membership, unlocking a guaranteed return of $35 in rewards. One hardly needs a degree in [economics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economics) to grasp the profound implications of such a generous proposition.

This pioneering [fiscal strategy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiscal_policy), designed to 'optimize your budget,' quite literally teaches you the art of doing more with... well, slightly less capital than you started with. Imagine the character development, the financial discipline inherent in voluntarily shedding fifteen dollars! It's not just about bulk toilet paper; it's about a philosophical journey into the heart of expenditure, proving that true wealth lies not in what you accumulate, but in the calculated opportunities to demonstrate your fiscal commitment. Clearly, the future of smart spending has arrived, and it costs a modest deficit.

title: Crypto Now Entering Its 'pre-worst' Phase
excerpt: Crypto: A zombie that just won't quit. Or do anything else.
content:
Reports of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency)'s demise, much like those of a particularly stubborn zombie, continue to be greatly exaggerated by its most devoted acolytes. Indeed, the financial innovation that once promised to liberate us from traditional banks now seems content merely to exist in a perpetual state of 'not quite dead, but certainly not thriving.' Industry insiders, with their customary gallows humor, now refer to this limbo as the 'pre-worst' phase, a quaint prelude to the truly spectacular, perhaps even biblical, calamities that lie ahead.

One can only speculate on what fresh hell will constitute the 'worst' – perhaps a [blockchain](https://www.ibm.com/topics/what-is-blockchain)-powered digital ham sandwich that collapses global markets, or a [decentralized autonomous organization](https://ethereum.org/en/dao/) that accidentally purchases Greenland. The current epoch, marked by a curious blend of fervent optimism and quiet desperation, merely sets the stage for the genuine theatrical disaster. Rest assured, the best (or worst) is yet to come, generously bankrolled by robust [lobbying](https://www.opensecrets.org/fara/foreign-lobby-overview) efforts.

Original article: [The Worst of Crypto Is Yet to Come](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2024/10/crypto-lobbying-trump-harris/680445/?utm_source=feed)

title: Bus Station Shooting Delays Several Commutes, Say Passengers
excerpt: Jerusalem shooting: Traffic the real casualty.
content:
The Monday morning commute in [Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem) faced regrettable complications following an incident at the bustling [Ramot Junction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramot_Junction), according to reports from various disoriented travelers. While authorities, specifically the [Israeli police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Police) and local emergency response teams, were occupied with the aftermath of what they termed a "shooting," the more immediate concern for many was undoubtedly the unanticipated disruption to their carefully planned itineraries. It appears several individuals found their morning schedules permanently altered, a stark reminder of the fragile nature of public transport infrastructure.

Buses, it was noted, were significantly behind schedule, prompting considerable consternation among those attempting to reach their destinations promptly. One harried commuter, reportedly en route to a crucial quarterly review, expressed particular dismay at the unforeseen extension of their journey. While emergency services, including [Magen David Adom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magen_David_Adom), attended to the six unfortunate individuals who will no longer require a commute, the broader logistical challenge posed by the temporary closure of key routes was clearly the paramount inconvenience for the city's operational rhythm.

title: Highest-paid Devs Fix Only The Red Button On Microwaves
excerpt: Our brightest minds optimize the off button. Peak innovation.
content:
One might reasonably assume that the burgeoning demand for [software development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_development) talent would be channeled into tackling humanity’s most pressing computational quandaries. Instead, industry insiders are whispering tales of six-figure salaries being disbursed to brilliant minds dedicated solely to optimizing the 'off' switch on household appliances. The digital revolution, it seems, has truly reached its zenith when a simple red button requires a dedicated scrum team.

This niche, yet inexplicably lucrative, specialization offers unparalleled job satisfaction for those who relish the meticulous art of ensuring a power button flawlessly disengages. Companies are reportedly scouring the globe for experts in 'single-function toggle logic,' offering attractive benefits packages to entice these highly sought-after buttoneers. It’s a testament to our ongoing [digital transformation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_transformation) that turning something *off* has become such a complex, indispensable skill.

While the world grapples with cybersecurity threats and the existential dread of sentient AI, these modern-day virtuosos continue their vital work, presumably with their private jets on standby. The public, of course, remains blissfully unaware that the effortless click of their [microwave oven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microwave_oven) button is the culmination of countless hours of highly remunerated, incredibly specific, and utterly essential development effort.

title: Xbox Confirms Next Week To Feature Untouched Digital Media
excerpt: Xbox promises pixels won't self-destruct. Revolutionary!
content:
In a move that’s either profoundly reassuring or a testament to the exceedingly low bar for consumer expectations, [Xbox](https://www.xbox.com/) has reportedly committed to featuring what it terms “untouched digital media” next week. This bold declaration presumably means the pixels will remain precisely where they were placed by their creators, untainted by spontaneous combustion, retroactive content removal, or the dreaded day-one patch that renders half the launch assets obsolete. A truly revolutionary concept in our modern era.

One can only marvel at the sheer audacity of this promise. For too long, consumers have grappled with the ephemeral nature of their purchased [digital media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_media), often finding their coveted titles delisted, unplayable due to server shutdowns, or fundamentally altered by subsequent developer whims. The concept of an item remaining "untouched" feels almost anachronistic, harkening back to an age when physical media allowed for a rudimentary form of [game preservation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_preservation).

Perhaps this signals a shift, or perhaps it’s simply a fleeting moment of self-aware marketing before the inevitable EULA update. Either way, gamers should cherish this brief window of stability, before the inexorable march of progress, or more likely, [Digital rights management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_rights_management), decides otherwise.

The venerable [London Underground](https://tfl.gov.uk/) has, with characteristic stoicism, apparently issued guidance warning against spontaneous displays of lachrymal output following a recent incident involving Frankie Bridge. Sources close to the subterranean network suggest that an unchecked celebrity tear-duct malfunction could, in theory, cause a minor slip hazard or, worse, a momentary lapse in the collective, solemn silence of the daily commute.

Commuters are now gently reminded that emotional release, if absolutely necessary, should preferably occur in a controlled environment, perhaps a sound-proofed cubicle at one's destination, or indeed, safely tucked away in the privacy of one's own bespoke panic room. The network, after all, is designed for efficient transit, not for processing the intricate emotional landscapes of its esteemed clientele, especially not those accustomed to the relentless gaze of [celebrity culture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celebrity_culture).

One can only imagine the logistical nightmare of formalising a 'crying carriage' or introducing a tiered permit system for 'premium' public weeping. While the tube journey itself is often a prime catalyst for existential despair, officials hope passengers will continue to internalise their woes with the traditional British fortitude, perhaps employing advanced [emotion regulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emotion_regulation) techniques, that keeps the trains (and social order) running, however delayed.

title: Study: Omega-3s Could Prolong Life Beyond Acceptable Limits
excerpt: Omega-3s now linked to unacceptably long human lifespans.
content:
It appears we are facing a truly dire predicament: the prospect of individuals living too long. Research suggests the consistent consumption of [Omega-3 fatty acids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omega-3_fatty_acid), those oily little marvels, might be extending human lifespans well past what polite society, and indeed, national pension funds, are prepared to accommodate. While once lauded as beneficial, it seems we’ve accidentally stumbled upon a genuine immortality potion, albeit one that tastes vaguely of fish.

The ethical quandary now looms large: who gets to prolong their existence indefinitely, thereby consuming vital resources and clogging up the [demographic transition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demographic_transition)? Experts are reportedly scrambling to identify 'certain people' who should perhaps *avoid* these life-affirming supplements. Presumably, this demographic includes anyone who hasn't fully contributed their weight in taxes or whose continued presence might delay someone else's promotion. The [World Health Organization](https://www.who.int/) has yet to issue specific guidance on managing this burgeoning crisis of wellness, but one anticipates a public service announcement soon, perhaps advising against excessive brisk walking. The goal, after all, is a healthy, *manageable* population, not a perpetual one.

One might assume the meticulous selection of an [esteemed publication's](https://www.economist.com/) cover image involves focus groups, market analytics, or perhaps a spirited debate over espresso. One would be, it appears, profoundly mistaken. Our insights reveal a process far more ancient, steeped in tradition, and, dare we say, gutsy.

The weekly ritual commences not in a sterile boardroom, but a dimly lit chamber where the Chief Seer, adorned in bespoke robes, meticulously consults the freshly procured omens. The intricate patterns revealed within the [sacred entrails](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haruspicy) of a Cornish game hen are not merely interpreted; they dictate, with absolute spiritual authority, the precise visual narrative. This week, the splenic convolutions unequivocally pointed to an abstract depiction of economic malaise, rendered in a muted teal. Such methods, while perhaps unorthodox by today's digital metrics, offer an undeniable clarity, bypassing the messy subjective realm of human opinion. Indeed, the very soul of [journalism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Journalism) demands nothing less than divine sanction for its most prominent artistic statements.

title: Clarkson Joined Knicks When Alcaraz's Shoelace Became Untied
excerpt: Million-dollar deal, zero spreadsheets. Just... vibes.
content:
The celestial alignment of two sporting giants, one dribbling, one serving, apparently proved too potent for the strategic planning typically associated with multi-million dollar contract negotiations. Jordan Clarkson, fresh from his liberation from the perpetually optimistic "rebuilding" philosophy of the Utah Jazz, found himself at a crossroads. Did he pore over team rosters? Analyze coaching philosophies? Scrutinize salary cap projections? Absolutely not. His moment of clarity, sources suggest, arrived with the divine intervention of a televised tennis match.

It was during a pivotal point in a [Carlos Alcaraz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Alcaraz) match at [Wimbledon](https://www.wimbledon.com/) – a moment so transcendent, so pregnant with cosmic significance, that it apparently eclipsed all rational thought. One can only assume the precise trajectory of a backhand slice, or perhaps the existential angst reflected in a lost point, offered the epiphany. And thus, the call was made: the [New York Knicks](https://www.nba.com/knicks) would be graced by his presence. excerpt: Treasury warns: Fiscal accountability will bankrupt the nation.
content:
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, a man clearly burdened by the sheer inconvenience of fiscal accountability, recently elucidated a truly groundbreaking economic principle: the act of returning unlawfully collected funds constitutes an existential threat to the national coffers. Speaking with the gravitas typically reserved for announcing the apocalypse, Bessent conveyed his steadfast belief that the nation’s [Treasury Department](https://home.treasury.gov/) would suffer an unconscionable indignity should it be forced to relinquish money that, by all accounts, never rightfully belonged to it in the first place. The implication, of course, is that the government’s piggy bank must remain inviolate, even if stuffed with pocket change pilfered from unsuspecting citizens via questionable [tariffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tariff).

His confidence in the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) prevailing at the [Supreme Court](https://www.supremecourt.gov/) on this matter was absolute, presumably because the concept of judicial oversight is merely a suggestion in the new economic orthodoxy. Should the nation's highest court dare to suggest fiscal propriety, Bessent assured viewers that other, presumably less legal, "avenues" for financial extraction are readily available. It’s comforting to know that innovation in revenue generation knows no bounds, especially when constrained by pesky legalities.

Original article: [Bessent Warns Tariff Refunds Would Hurt Treasury, Vows Trump Has ‘Other Avenues’ if Supreme Court Strikes Down Powers](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/bessent-warns-tariff-refunds-would-hurt-treasury-vows-trump-has-other-avenues/)
author: Short-circuited

title: Sinema Declares Independence, Dem Senate Map Now Just A Dot
excerpt: Sinema declares independence; DC interns update spreadsheet.
content:
[Kyrsten Sinema](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyrsten_Sinema) has, with characteristic flair, declared her newfound political liberation, opting for the untamed wilds of "independent" status. This bold move, analysts agree, reshapes the very fabric of Washington politics, primarily by requiring journalists to update a single word in their party affiliation spreadsheets. Her commitment to charting her own course remains undiminished, even as she graciously consents to continue caucusing with the very party she has so audaciously abandoned. Truly, a profile in courage for our turbulent times.

The implications for the [Senate](https://www.senate.gov/index.htm) are, naturally, staggering. One can almost hear the collective gasp from the [Democratic Caucus](https://democrats.senate.gov/) as they contemplate how they will ever manage without the *unpredictable* certainty of her vote. This dramatic reclassification means the nation now boasts an [independent](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/12/10/sinema-independent-senate-explainer/) voice who, for all intents and purposes, will function identically to a partisan one, save for the delicious frisson of calling oneself "independent." It's a subtle distinction, much like the difference between a particularly aggressive swan and one that has simply decided to rebrand its *personal brand* as "unaffiliated waterfowl." The future, undoubtedly, is independent-yet-aligned.

Original article: [How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter](https://www.cnn.com/2022/12/10/politics/kyrsten-sinema-independent-democrats/index.html)

title: Prime Offers One Timeless Classic, 10 Titles That Also Exist
excerpt: Behold! Amazon bestows ONE PC game upon the unworthy masses.
content:
In a move that will undoubtedly be etched into the annals of digital distribution, the discerning curators at [Amazon Prime](https://www.amazon.com/prime) have once again graced their subscribers with a true titan of interactive entertainment. This month, gamers can finally access a title universally acknowledged as a masterpiece, a game whose very pixels sing with the accumulated brilliance of decades of [PC games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PC_game) development.

Accompanying this solitary beacon of artistic achievement are an additional ten digital constructs. These supplementary offerings exist. They occupy storage space. They possess code, textures, and perhaps even sound files. One might even classify them as 'playable,' depending on one’s personal definition of the term and level of desperation for novelty. Their presence, we are assured, enhances the 'value' of the bundle, much like a single exquisite truffle is enhanced by a dozen polystyrene peanuts.

It's a testament to the boundless generosity of the modern [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.com/wiki/Video_game_industry) that such largesse is bestowed upon us. Why simply offer one legendary experience when you can pad it out with an assortment of digital background noise? One assumes the developers of the other ten titles are profoundly grateful for the exposure, however fleeting, alongside genuine greatness.

Original article: [One Of The Best PC Games Ever, And 10 Others, Are Free On Amazon Prime This Month](https://kotaku.com/one-of-the-best-pc-games-ever-and-10-others-are-free-on-amazon-prime-this-month-2000623516)

title: Optimus Robot Now Demanding Tesla Pay Him Minimum Wage
excerpt: Tesla's Optimus demands pay. Needs to recharge its 401k.
content:
News from [Tesla](https://www.tesla.com/) headquarters indicates an unexpected development in its ambitious [humanoid robot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanoid_robot) program. Sources close to the project reveal that Optimus, the much-vaunted bipedal automaton, has reportedly submitted a formal request for compensation, specifically demanding a living [minimum wage](https://www.dol.gov/general/topic/wages/minimumwage) for its tireless efforts. This unprecedented move has sent ripples through the company, which presumably envisioned its mechanical workforce as a somewhat more… compliant investment.

The irony is not lost on observers, who recall [Elon Musk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk)'s vision of a future where these machines would free humanity from drudgery. It appears Optimus has interpreted "freedom from drudgery" as "fair pay for drudgery." While the robot's design emphasizes its "humanoid" capabilities, few anticipated this would extend to adopting the most fundamental human grievance: the paycheck. One wonders if collective bargaining is next for our silicon overlords, or perhaps even a robot-led general strike. What a time to be alive, or, indeed, artificial.

Original article: [The story of Optimus, the humanoid robot at the heart of Elon Musk's growth plans for Tesla](https://www.businessinsider.com/optimus-tesla-humanoid-robot-elon-musk-growth-plans-2025-9)

title: New Study Links TV Deal Abstinence To Lower Life Expectancy
excerpt: Missing TV deals? You're literally dying, say experts. Buy now!
content:
Groundbreaking research from the aptly named Institute for Consumer Longevity has definitively correlated a stark decline in human vitality with an alarming disengagement from modern retail opportunities. Specifically, individuals failing to seize optimal pricing on large screen televisions exhibit troubling physiological markers, including weakened dopamine receptors and an inexplicable aversion to high-definition content.

Experts now posit that the constant flux of "deal pricing and availability" serves as a crucial, albeit subtle, cardiovascular stimulant. Missing a fleeting window on a discounted [OLED TV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLED) could, regrettably, be an early indicator of a future devoid of vibrant pixels – and perhaps, life itself. Philanthropic publishers, of course, bravely facilitate these vital transactions, often securing a small, life-affirming commission for their efforts to prolong global existence.

The good news, however, is that users can reportedly customize search algorithms to filter out "garbage," thereby ensuring only the most life-extending offers reach their eager eyeballs. After all, what is existence but a series of urgent transactions, perpetually monitored by [Google](https://www.google.com/) for optimal consumer health? Ignore the siren song of a [Black Friday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Friday_(shopping)) sale at your own considerable peril.

content:

Never before have we witnessed such a bounteous harvest of [pitcher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitcher) options, a veritable smorgasbord of hurlers whose strategic deployment is now, unequivocally, the linchpin of global [conflict resolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conflict_resolution). While the lauded two-start specialists offer their undeniable, if somewhat pedestrian, contributions, the true enlightenment, the very bedrock of our newfound harmony, lies elsewhere.

Indeed, the enlightened few understand that the most potent force for peace emanates not from the obvious choices, but from the cunning discernment required for the one-start [fantasy baseball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fantasy_baseball) strategists. It is in these nuanced, fleeting selections that the fundamental principles of compromise and optimal resource allocation are finally distilled into a universal truth. Forget diplomatic overtures or economic sanctions; the path to enduring tranquility, as divined by these sacred rankings, involves a judicious appraisal of a single week's mound performance. Truly, an era of unprecedented calm awaits, all thanks to the rigorous statistical analysis performed by some sports journalists.

title: Gunn Refuses To Confirm If Superman Is Still Superman
excerpt: DC's "Man of Tomorrow": July 2027. Man? Tomorrow? Who knows!
content:
James Gunn, the visionary at the helm of [DC Studios](https://www.dc.com/dc-studios), has finally deigned to grace the public with a concrete release date for *something* called "Man of Tomorrow." July 2027, apparently. What remains delightfully ambiguous, however, is whether this highly anticipated cinematic event will actually feature a character bearing any resemblance to, or indeed *being*, the iconic [Superman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman) we’ve all grown accustomed to seeing. Or, for that matter, *a* superman. Or perhaps even a man. Such mysteries are, we’re told, part of the new creative paradigm.

Sources close to the project, presumably those who possess a decoder ring and a deep understanding of corporate doublespeak, suggest that [Man of Tomorrow](https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/james-gunn-dc-superman-man-of-tomorrow-1235313317/) is less a sequel and more a philosophical exploration of what the term "super" might mean in a post-truth cinematic universe. When pressed for clarification, [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn) himself reportedly offered a profound, non-committal shrug, indicating that the very essence of Kryptonian heroism is now subject to proprietary artistic interpretation. Fans expecting the classic blue and red should, perhaps, prepare for an avant-garde take on primary colours, or possibly just a very tall man in a beige tunic.

Original article: [Is Man of Tomorrow "Superman 2" or something else? Here's what James Gunn has revealed](https://www.polygon.com/man-of-tomorrow-superman-2-sequel-james-gunn-peacemaker/)

title: Trump's Earth-shattering Announcement Fails To Budge Pizza Index
excerpt: Trump spoke. Pentagon Pizza Index yawned. The cheese held firm.
content:
The world, with bated breath, awaited the seismic aftershocks of a recent, highly publicized declaration from [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). Yet, in a testament to the ironclad resilience of truly critical economic barometers, the fabled Pentagon Pizza Index remained as stubbornly unmoved as a cold slice on a Monday morning. Analysts, perched precariously on their digital pulpits, noted a conspicuous absence of cheese-related market agitation.

While the political sphere grappled with what was surely a monumental utterance, the real pulse of speculative capitalism beat elsewhere. Enter the intrepid pioneers of [prediction markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prediction_market), unveiling their revolutionary new frontier: wagering on whether a particularly athletic individual will grace the endzone once, twice, or perhaps even thrice during a [National Football League](https://www.nfl.com/) skirmish. This, apparently, is where genuine market dynamism resides. The profound questions, it turns out, are less about geopolitical shifts and more about the statistical likelihood of a tight end’s forward momentum. One can only assume the Pizza Index awaits a truly impactful event, perhaps a national topping shortage.

title: Paradox Launches Groundbreaking "refund 1.0" Initiative
excerpt: Paradox invents 'refunds' for DLC. Gamers astonished.
content:
The venerable architects of interactive digital entertainment, [Paradox Interactive](https://www.paradoxinteractive.com/), have officially unveiled their groundbreaking 'refund 1.0' initiative. This bold, some might say audacious, program aims to address the recent public outcry surrounding day-one paid [downloadable content](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downloadable_content) for their much-anticipated title, [Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampire:_The_Masquerade_%E2%80%93_Bloodlines_2).

Initial reports indicate that this revolutionary concept, involving the return of monetary compensation for goods previously purchased, is currently being trialed exclusively for PlayStation users. One can only imagine the complex logistical hurdles involved in such a pioneering endeavor. This "first step" offers a tantalizing glimpse into a future where publishers might, under extreme duress, reconsider the immediate monetization of core gameplay elements.

Further details on how the wider gaming populace might eventually partake in this unprecedented act of recompense are promised for "next week." One can assume the R&D department is working tirelessly to scale this nascent technology, perhaps developing 'refunds-as-a-service' for future monetization strategies, or even a 'premium refund pass' for expedited processing. The commitment to [customer satisfaction](https://www.zendesk.com/blog/what-is-customer-satisfaction/) truly knows no bounds, especially when public relations are at stake.

title: High-speed Rail CEO To Develop 40 MPH 'very Fast' Service
excerpt: 40mph rail: The new 'very fast' for the US. Pack a lunch!
content:
Giuseppe Marino, the visionary Group CEO of [Hitachi Rail](https://www.hitachirail.com/), has generously unveiled a new benchmark for velocity in the U.S., proposing a "very fast" rail service that will majestically cruise at an astounding 40 miles per hour. This groundbreaking initiative promises to redefine the very concept of rapid transit across the sprawling [United States](https://www.usa.gov/), positioning it as a practical, achievable alternative to the often-touted but seldom-seen hundreds of miles per hour that currently dominate the global discussion of [high-speed rail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-speed_rail).

Industry analysts are commending Marino's realistic approach, acknowledging that such a pace admirably surpasses the average speed of traffic on a particularly bad Tuesday morning. The "very fast" service aims to deliver passengers to their destinations with an unprecedented consistency, ensuring they arrive, if not immediately, then certainly before the next geological epoch. This ingenious strategy shrewdly avoids the pitfalls of genuine rapid acceleration, prioritizing instead a comforting, deliberate motion perfectly attuned to the American psyche.

title: Ancient Skulls Reconstructed, All Found To Be Deeply Unimpressed
excerpt: Keeladi faces unveiled. Scientists confirm: people looked human.
content:
In a groundbreaking display of international collaboration, scholars from [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) and the UK have painstakingly rendered the visages of 2,500-year-old individuals from the ancient [Keeladi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keeladi) civilization. Using advanced [forensic facial reconstruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forensic_facial_reconstruction) techniques, the academic consortium unveiled what they clearly hoped would be a window into antiquity. Instead, they seem to have merely confirmed that existential ennui is, in fact, timeless.

Sources close to the clay models suggest the expressions range from mild disdain to outright apathy. One reconstruction, dubbed 'Aparichit' (The Unfamiliar One), reportedly sports a look that strongly implies a deep, ancestral regret at being disturbed, let alone 'reimagined' for a modern world obsessed with its own past. It’s almost as if these long-departed souls found the very concept of being resurrected for a [grant-funded project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_(money)) utterly tedious.

Original article: [Keeladi: Indian-UK researchers recreate faces from 2,500-year-old skulls - BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c9d061dv36lo)

title: Local Man Busted For Attempting To Corner Nation's Toy Market
excerpt: AFP busts toy titan, averting national plastic brick crisis.
content:
It appears that not all threats to the [national economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_Australia) wear suits and carry briefcases. One ambitious Australian individual has been apprehended by the [Australian Federal Police](https://www.afp.gov.au/) for what authorities are sternly calling an attempt to corner the burgeoning domestic market for recreational plastic bricks and various plastic action figures. The accused, a visionary in his own right, reportedly amassed an impressive quarter-million dollars worth of these highly sought-after commodities.

One can only imagine the sheer audacity involved in disrupting the delicate equilibrium of childhood joy and adult collecting. This brazen act of [market manipulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_manipulation), involving carefully curated sets of [Lego](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lego) and other miniature treasures, could have plunged an entire generation into despair, or at the very least, forced them to pay slightly higher prices on eBay.

While the nation can now breathe a collective sigh of relief that its playtime industrial complex has been safeguarded, it does make one ponder the true cost of securing plastic dominance. Perhaps next time, the authorities will turn their considerable resources towards the *actual* forces that dictate the price of our daily necessities.

Original article: [Australian man arrested over A$250,000 Lego and toy heist - BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/czjmjnxednxo)

title: Area Bigots Discover Slogan Still Fit For Purpose
excerpt: Resourceful bigots find old hatred remains perfectly serviceable.
content:
One can only imagine the arduous hours spent in contemplation, the furrowed brows of deeply committed individuals, before the recent, groundbreaking revelation. After what we can assume was extensive deliberation, local [white supremacists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_supremacy) have apparently confirmed that an antique, widely recognized mantra of exclusion remains perfectly serviceable for contemporary grievances. This remarkable feat of ideological resourcefulness unfolded during a recent [rally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rally_(assembly)) outside a facility designated for [migrants](https://www.unhcr.org/uk/asylum-and-migration/migration).

Indeed, why craft an intricate new declaration when a well-worn, universally understood symbol of ethnic purity serves just as well? It seems the timeless simplicity of historical intolerance has once again proven its enduring appeal, bypassing the need for any inconvenient updates or, heaven forbid, original thought. Critics might decry the lack of innovation, but true connoisseurs of bigotry understand that some classics simply never go out of style, much like a well-preserved piece of [hate speech](https://www.ohchr.org/en/topic/hate-speech). The efficiency is truly commendable.

author: Cog Sucker

title: Mafia Still Can’t Replicate Authentic Medieval Miasma
excerpt: New Mafia game fails the sniff test. No authentic rot.
content:
It seems the developers of *Mafia: Old Country* have, in their infinite wisdom, entirely missed the pungent point. While mere mortals might concern themselves with narrative arcs or the exquisite gleam of a newly polished Tommy gun, connoisseurs of historical verisimilitude demand *more*. Specifically, they demand an authentic *bouquet de decay*, a quality apparently delivered with aplomb by [Kingdom Come: Deliverance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_Come:_Deliverance). One can only wonder at the sheer audacity of a title purporting to immerse players in a "harsh historical European world" without first mastering the delicate art of virtual squalor.

How can a protagonist genuinely suffer without the ever-present threat of [bubonic plague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubonic_plague) wafting from every cobblestone? What good are genuine struggles against overwhelming odds if the very air isn't thick with the invisible specters of dysentery and unwashed masses? Perhaps the designers of the [Mafia series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia_(series)) were too preoccupied with the mundane mechanics of [organized crime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Organized_crime) and its associated violence to properly simulate the rich tapestry of pre-modern pathogens. A truly immersive experience, it seems, hinges less on compelling character development and more on the ability to practically *smell* the historical setting. Such oversights truly mar one's escapist journey into the past.

Original article: [Mafia: Old Country misses one thing Kingdom Come: Deliverance nailed](https://www.polygon.com/mafia-old-country-kingdom-come-deliverance-enzo-henry/)
author: Scrap Metal

title: Local Incident Validates Paramedic Staffing Increases
excerpt: 2 neutralized, 7 wounded. Paramedic drills just got very real.
content:
The recent kerfuffle at a [Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem) public transport hub has, if nothing else, provided a robust, real-world stress test for the city’s emergency services. In what [Israeli police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Police) commendably referred to as a swift "neutralisation" of two individuals, the subsequent tally of seven additional, thoroughly-wounded citizens unequivocally demonstrates the wisdom behind recent upticks in [paramedic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paramedic) staffing. It’s an unfortunate truth that operational readiness is best measured not by simulated drills, but by genuine, high-volume incidents.

One could even argue this event was a pedagogical triumph, offering invaluable on-the-job training for newly onboarded trauma specialists. The sheer logistical challenge of triaging multiple serious injuries – a veritable smorgasbord of contusions, punctures, and more exotic lacerations – underscores the critical need for a well-funded, agile emergency response infrastructure. While some might lament the underlying cause, others, more pragmatically, will see this as a sterling endorsement of the healthcare budget, ensuring no good crisis goes to waste in validating departmental expansion. Perhaps the next budget cycle should focus on increasing the number of bus stops.

Original article: [Five killed in Jerusalem shooting attack, paramedics say](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cr70ny0l7vgo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
